definition: to startle/to be frightened/to be scared/alarm

sentences.english: "How knewest thou that I was here?" asked the minister fearfully.
sentences.chinese: “你怎么会知道我在这儿呢？”牧师惊惧地问。

sentences.english: For the waves of death encompassed me, the torrents of destruction assailed me;
sentences.chinese: 曾有死亡的波浪环绕我，匪类的急流使我惊惧。

sentences.english: I knew I could do nothing about it, so all terrorization also ceased to exist.
sentences.chinese: 我知道自己无能为力，于是一切惊惧也不复存在。

sentences.english: With singed hair, the panicky woman just escaped from the fire.
sentences.chinese: 这个惊惧的妇人，带著烧焦的头发，刚刚逃离火场。

sentences.english: In the following year, Pan was horrified to discover his tongue shrinking.
sentences.chinese: 第二年，潘惊惧地发现他的舌头在缩短。

sentences.english: But it may just put the fear of God into Europe's politicians—indeed, that may be the idea.
sentences.chinese: 然而，这也是让欧洲政客们感到一丝惊惧，正是此意。

sentences.english: Whoever took these pictures did an awesome job.
sentences.chinese: 无论是谁拍下的这些照片，都做了一件令人惊惧的事。

sentences.english: It should be done smoothly, without panicking the sheep and causing them to scatter or run.
sentences.chinese: 这个经过应当很安稳，不应使羊群感到惊惧而散奔逃。

sentences.english: At this, all Adonijah's guests rose in alarm and dispersed.
sentences.chinese: 亚多尼雅的众客听见这话就都惊惧，起来四散。

definition: to be shocked/to be appalled/to be terrified
overwhelmed with shock, horror or amazement/dumbstruck/aghast
to be surprised/to be amazed/to be stunned
